div1.p: Linson reports that Long has no knowledge of bubonic or pneumonic plague epidemics on ships.

div1.head: Letter from J.H. Linson to Henry Rose Carter, December 4, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Plague
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
December 4, 1924.
Assistant Surgeon General H.R. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
2122 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Before his departure, Dr. Long requested
me to reply to your letter of the twenty ninth
ultimo.

Dr. Long stated that he had no knowledge
of anything that could be called an epidemic of
bubonic plague aboard vessels on the high seas.
Also, that he could not recall any report of
an epidemic of pneumonic plague aboard ship.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, J. H. Linson. JHL/LAR
